definition: Scientific disciplines that apply theoretical knowledge to solve practical problems in industry, technology, and society.

positive_examples: The engineering team designed a new bridge using structural analysis principles.
Computer scientists developed an algorithm to optimize delivery routes.
The actuary calculated insurance premiums based on statistical risk models.
Library science professionals organized digital archives using information management systems.
Software engineers applied machine learning techniques to improve search results.
The civil engineer used geological data to design earthquake-resistant buildings.
negative_examples: The physicist discovered a new particle in the laboratory experiment.
Marine biologists studied coral reef ecosystems in their natural habitat.
The chemist analyzed the molecular structure of organic compounds.
Astronomers observed distant galaxies through the space telescope.
Botanists classified new plant species found in the rainforest.
The mathematician proved a new theorem about prime numbers.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: PureSciences, NaturalSciences, TheoreticalSciences, ExperimentalSciences
